alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 20 at 1:26PM PST until January 22 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong north to east winds Friday through Saturday... .North to east winds will increase across interior Northern California Friday morning. The strongest winds will be in the Northern Sierra and western Plumas County mountains Friday afternoon through Saturday morning, with damaging gusts up to 50 to 70+ mph possible. For the Valley, the strongest winds will be concentrated in the western portion of the Sacramento and northern San Joaquin Valleys, especially near the Delta region and extending into the Sacramento and Stockton metro areas, through Friday evening. The main impacts will be in the mountains. Residents and those with outdoor recreation plans should be prepared for downed trees and tree limbs, local power outages, and difficult driving conditions. ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM FRIDAY TO 7 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 to 40 mph expected. * WHERE...Central Sacramento Valley, Southern Sacramento Valley, Carquinez Strait and Delta and Northern San Joaquin Valley Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM Friday to 7 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs and weakened trees could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Avoid forested areas as gusty winds could blow down trees and branches. Stay clear of power lines. Secure outdoor objects.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley
